pullRequest.body:
Co-authored-by : @jjaassoonn 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [63dcdd9437](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18195/commits/63dcdd9437a5eabae6f81d6bc5b82b2c71dff53b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.DirectSum.Idempotents` (new file)|1092|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ completeOrthogonalIdempotents_idempotent`
`+ decompose_eq_mul_idempotent`
`+ idempotent`
`+ isIdempotentElem_idempotent`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

And I think (also judging from the "large-import" tag) this belongs to `Mathlib.Algebra.DirectSum.Idempotents` or something similar.

Also please update the PR title so that it matches with the content.

Thanks a lot!

bors d+

:v: Whysoserioushah can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12612942383/job/35150213521)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12612942383/job/35150213595)

The PR looks good to me aside from some docstrings that I couldn't fully parse nor improve on.

But I think I have requested too many alterations to comfortably maintainer merge this and I'll wait for a third opinion.
Wait I just noticed I deleted a review by Moritz on accident. I'm very sorry about that. This is the reconstructed review according to my mailbox.

Also please fix the build errors.
In general, please try to make sure that there are no build errors before removing the `awaiting-author` tag, as the PR will not appear on the queue if there are build errors.
Also is it possible to

The PR looks good to me aside from some docstrings that I couldn't fully parse nor improve on.

But I think I have requested too many alterations to comfortably maintainer merge this and I'll wait for a third opinion.
Looking at name `OrthogonalIdempotents.mul_eq`, maybe this one should be called `OrthogonalIdempotents.mul_eq.ne_add`
Or maybe `IsPrimitiveIdempotents.xxx`
deleted
This lemma belongs to `Mathlib.Algebra.DirectSum.Decomposition` or something like that, and probably can be generalized
Done!
The name probably should be `OrthogonalIdempotents.xxx`
Also the proof is extremely long, is it possible to break it down

> The name probably should be `OrthogonalIdempotents.xxx`

good idea, fixed

> Also the proof is extremely long, is it possible to break it down

fixed!
Is it better to use `[NeZero f]` and `[NeZero g]` here? Not too sure
should be the same though
done
Should this be called `IsPrimitiveIdempotents` or `PrimititiveIdempotents` to match names like `OrthogonalIdempotents`
Probably `IsPrimitiveIdempotent`
I don't understand what this lemma is for. Can you point me to an application?
It's used in the later theorem I'm gonna push in the next PR about this
hmmm actually u're right, deleted!

```suggestion
structure IsPrimitiveIdempotents (e : R) : Prop where
```

I'm a bit unclear about whether we should be proving lemmas about `( i  rep.support, rep i : M)`. Looking through this file it seems that the canonical name for this function is `DirectSum.coeAddMonoidHom  r`. If you are sure you need theorems about `( i  rep.support, rep i : M)` then I suspect that the theorem to prove about it is
```lean
lemma sum_support_eq_coe (r :  i,  i) [(i : )  (x : ( i))  Decidable (x  0)] :
    ( i  r.support, r i : M) = DirectSum.coeAddMonoidHom  r := by
  sorry
```
and then your lemma is just
```lean
lemma decompose_unique (rep rep :  i,  i) [(i : )  (x : ( i))  Decidable (x  0)]
    (h : ( i  rep.support, rep i : M) = ( i  rep.support, rep i)) :
    rep = rep := by
  repeat rw [sum_support_eq_coe] at h
  exact ((decompose ).symm.injective h).symm
```
fixed!
I don't think those square brackets can be right because `e  0` isn't a typeclass.
What about `[ne_zero : NeZero e]`
removed!

You surely can't make a definition and then make no API for it. A PR should do one thing; this PR is proving two theorems and then adding a definition which is not mentioned in the theorems, so it's doing two things. I know you have theorems about this structure but the PR with those theorems should be the one where the structure is added.
Definition removed and will be added to another PR!
I would imagine that `Ideal R` is the canonical form for `Submodule R R`.
I really don't know what to use these two seemed to be definitionally equal...

Yes, they might be equal, but still it makes sense to ask what the canonical form in mathlib is, i.e. should our theorems about ideals talk about `Ideal R` or `Submodule R R`, and the decision made in Mathlib is that we prove lots of theorems about `Ideal R`, so your theorems should also be about `Ideal R`.
done!
Isn't this just a painful way of saying `e = decompose V 1`? I would imagine that the latter is a more canonical way to say this.
changed!
Surely the canonical way to say this is `  i  DFinsupp.support e`.
done!
done!
The module docstring says "finitely many left ideals" but you are explicitly dropping the assumption that the index set is finite on the line above.
good point, finitely many deleted!
Again I'm not convinced that this is the hypothesis you want, because we have a much more natural way to say it.
Yes and changed!

```suggestion
    [Decomposition V] (i) : IsIdempotentElem (decompose V 1 i : R) := by
  classical
  set e := decompose V 1 with he
```
Is there a reason why this lemma is not stated like this?

And the proof is just
```
open DirectSum in
omit [Fintype I] in
lemma decomp_ring_ortho_idem_is_idem [DecidableEq I] (V : I  Ideal R)
    [Decomposition V] (i) : IsIdempotentElem (decompose V 1 i : R) := by
  rw [IsIdempotentElem,  smul_eq_mul,  Submodule.coe_smul,  smul_apply,
     decompose_smul, smul_eq_mul, mul_one, decompose_coe, of_eq_same]
```
thanks, changed!

Similarly, this is just
```
theorem OrthogonalIdempotent.decomp_ring_ortho_idem [DecidableEq I] (V : I  Ideal R)
    [Decomposition V] :
    OrthogonalIdempotents (R := R) fun i  decompose V 1 i where
  idem := decomp_ring_ortho_idem_is_idem V 
  ortho := fun i j hij  by
    simp only
    rw [ smul_eq_mul,  Submodule.coe_smul,  smul_apply,
       decompose_smul, smul_eq_mul, mul_one, decompose_coe, of_eq_of_ne (h := hij),
      Submodule.coe_zero]
```

Probably the right thing to do is something like
```
def DirectSum.idempotent [DecidableEq I] (V : I  Ideal R) [Decomposition V] (i : I) : R :=
  decompose V 1 i

lemma DirectSum.decompose_eq_mul_idempotent [DecidableEq I] (V : I  Ideal R) [Decomposition V]
    (x : R) (i : I) : decompose V x i = x * idempotent V i := by
  rw [ smul_eq_mul (a := x), idempotent,  Submodule.coe_smul,  smul_apply,  decompose_smul,
    smul_eq_mul, mul_one]
```

> Probably the right thing to do is something like
> 
> ```
> def DirectSum.idempotent [DecidableEq I] (V : I  Ideal R) [Decomposition V] (i : I) : R :=
>   decompose V 1 i
> 
> lemma DirectSum.decompose_eq_mul_idempotent [DecidableEq I] (V : I  Ideal R) [Decomposition V]
>     (x : R) (i : I) : decompose V x i = x * idempotent V i := by
>   rw [ smul_eq_mul (a := x), idempotent,  Submodule.coe_smul,  smul_apply,  decompose_smul,
>     smul_eq_mul, mul_one]
> ```

where do you think we should put it?
I think all this can go into a new file `Mathlib.Algebra.DirectSum.Idempotents`.
All of these or just this few lines?
Judging from the "large-import" tag, I think the new `OrthogonalIdempotent.decomp_ring_ortho_idem` results belongs there too.
is it okay now? :)
Please fix the build errors

And `DirectSum.decompose_eq_mul_idempotent` can probably be used to golf the other two results. 
Those two results need better names too.
what names do you suggest?

```suggestion
    [Decomposition V] (i) : IsIdempotentElem (idempotent V i : R) := by
```
So this lemma should be called `isIdempotentElem_idempotent` according to the [naming convention](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html). 
Similar below.
thanks name changed
I think we should move `[DecidableEq I] (V : I  Ideal R) [Decomposition V]` to variables?
sure
done!

```suggestion
    [Decomposition V] (I : I) : IsIdempotentElem (idempotent V i : R) := by
```

The point of `decompose_eq_mul_idempotent` is to not go through so many hoops here.
```suggestion
  rw [IsIdempotentElem,  decompose_eq_mul_idempotent, idempotent, decompose_coe, of_eq_same]
```
Or you can even provide lemmas concerning `decompose V (idempotent V i) j` if you like.

```suggestion
    OrthogonalIdempotents fun i  idempotent V i where
```

```suggestion
    rw [ decompose_eq_mul_idempotent, idempotent, decompose_coe,
      of_eq_of_ne (h := hij), Submodule.coe_zero]
```
Similar here.

According to the [naming conventions](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html), this should be called `orthogonalIdempotents_idempotent`. There is no `isOrthoIdempotent` present in the type signature.
okay done!
Also, can you strengthen this to `CompleteOrthogonalIdempotents`? Thanks!
proved!

```suggestion
/-- The decomposition of `(1 : R)` into the direct sum of ideals which is also the identity
  of the ring induced by the directsum.-/
def idempotent (i : I) : R :=
```
Also I can't really understand the docstring.
I'll change it after I fix this error

Now that the type signature is `CompleteOrthogonalIdempotents` and not `OrthogonalIdempotents`, this should be called 
```suggestion
theorem completeOrthogonalIdempotents_idempotent [Fintype I]:
```

```suggestion
In this file we show that if a ring `R` can be decomposed into a direct sum
```

```suggestion
    apply (decompose V).injective
    refine DFunLike.ext _ _ fun i  ?_
    rw [decompose_sum, DFinsupp.finset_sum_apply]
    simp [idempotent, of_apply]
```
These lemmas feel quite strange to me. Where do you need them?
I used to need them... but not anymore I guess
I could delete them but it feels right to me to have a uniqueness of decomposition somewhere...?
I think the fact that `decompose` is injective is exactly uniqueness?
yeah you're probly right I'll delete them
Why is this change in this PR?
I dont know I made some change to this file and turned out we didnt need this, I could revert it if necessary
If we don't need the import then I guess it's fine. There is no other change to this file in this PR though.
Nothing breaks because of it so I guess its fine?

```suggestion
of (left) ideals `R = V  V      V` then in the corresponding decomposition
`1 = e + e +    + e` with `e  V`, each `e` is an idempotent and the
`e`'s form a family of complete orthogonal idempotents.
```

```suggestion
  ortho i j hij := by
```

```suggestion
# Decomposition of the identity of a ring into orthogonal idempotents

```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra): more on `OrthogonalIdempotents`
